726953f-c.title: Queens: Jacob Riis Park - [Rockaway Beach.]
726953f-c.text:
Jacob Riis Park (Queens): The Administration Building and other buildings in New York's newest seaside park and beach designed by Robert Moses. For additional
information see "The New York Times," June 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS  July 18, 1937
Views 1,2,3

726956f-a.title: Queens: Jacob Riis Park - [Rockaway Beach.]
726956f-a.text:
Jacob Riis Park (Queens / Rockaway): The beach on the Atlantic Ocean, which was opened to the public on June 19, 1937. This seaside park extends a mile long on the Rockaway Peninsula and fronts on both the Atlantic and Rockaway Inlet. For additional data see 'The New York Times,' June 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr  July 18, 1937
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2,3
726956f-a.folder: Jacob Riis Park & [Rockaway Beach.], Queens, NY

726959f-a.title: Queens: Jacob Riis Park - [Rockaway Peninsula - Rockaway Beach.]
726959f-a.text:
Jacob Riis Park (Queens): Views of New York City's newest beach on the Rockaway Peninsula dividing Jamaica Bay from the Atlantic Ocean. This seaside park, named for Jacob Riis, was opened to the public on June 19, 1937. For additional data see
"The New York Times," June 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr  July 18, 1937
View 1,2,3
726959f-a.folder: Jacob Riis Park & [Rockaway Peninsula & Rockaway Beach.], Queens, NY
